greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between prime(n)^2 and the next prime.
comment: Conjecturally, a(n) << log^2 n (with constant around 8/e^gamma in the supremum). [_Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 27 2011]

Except for a(2)=2, there are no terms = 2 mod 6 (as p^2+2 = 0 mod 3 for primes p > 3). Also, only 1 and 2 appear once while all other terms may appear (infinitely) many times. [_Zak Seidov_, Apr 18 2012]
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: prime(3)=5, 5*5=25 for k=4 25+4=29 prime, k=4 is the least k with prime(3)^2 + k prime.
results.author: _Pierre CAMI_, Jan 27 2004
